      PlayGround()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNut(Nut nut) 
      int changeNuts(java.lang.String location, int numberOfPlayer)
      this method move to all 8 direction from location of new nut and due to rolls of game change color of nuts (actually change their number) and also keep number of nuts that new nut changed their color in a variable named totalChanges more information on first while loop for moving to left .
      boolean checkEmpty(java.lang.String location)
      a method to check if there is a nut in given location or nut
      boolean checkLegality(java.lang.String location, int numberOfPlayer)
      this method this method first get i and j based on location then due to 8 direction around this location decide it is valid or not
      int checkPassEachSpot(java.lang.String location, int numberOfPlayer)
      this method is exactly the changeNuts method and works like it but only difference is in this method we do not change the color we just determine how many changes will happen output of this method will help us with checking a spot is valid or not

      void updateMap()
      this method first update map of nuts based on checking array list of nuts and location of each of them then method updates visual map due to changes in map of nuts like adding nut or changing their color

      • changeNuts

        public int changeNuts(java.lang.String location,
                      int numberOfPlayer)
        this method move to all 8 direction from location of new nut and due to rolls of game change color of nuts (actually change their number) and also keep number of nuts that new nut changed their color in a variable named totalChanges more information on first while loop for moving to left .
        Parameters:
        location - of new nut
        numberOfPlayer - number of player
        Returns:
        number of nuts that new nut changes their color

      • checkPassEachSpot

        public int checkPassEachSpot(java.lang.String location,
                             int numberOfPlayer)
        this method is exactly the changeNuts method and works like it but only difference is in this method we do not change the color we just determine how many changes will happen output of this method will help us with checking a spot is valid or not
        Parameters:
        location - we want to check
        numberOfPlayer - number of player
        Returns:
        number of nuts that putting nut in location will change their color
